snippet: A settlement that has freed up an additional $9.1 billion to repay creditors of Lehman Brothers International Europe could mean that those owed money by the European unit may receive all their money back, according to PricewaterhouseCoopers.
abstract: A settlement that has freed up an additional $9.1 billion to repay creditors of Lehman Brothers International Europe could mean that those owed money by the European unit may receive all their money back, according to PricewaterhouseCoopers.

headline.main: Creditors of Lehman's European Unit Could Be Completely Repaid
